Leo Wolf is a musician/artist/programmer from Charlotte, North Carolina. Getting his start in music production as a beatmaker under the alias Snoom, Leo developed a love for working with samples and heavily effected sounds. Through a combination of curiousity, instinct, and musical tastes, he began producing and performing more experimental forms of music falling into the drone and ambient genres. This ultimately led to deeper exploration of synthesis concepts and sound design, involving hardware synths & samplers, tape machines, effects pedals, and modular analog gear.

His work, in both the audio and visual realms, seeks to form and refine connections between the physical and metaphysical nature of existence, taking inspiration from memories, time, reflections, the occult, and symbolism in dreams. The labyrinth symbolizes the concept of a parallel existence between the inner and outer, and their inference of each other.

Leo is the founder and curator of the drone and experimental label Dead Letters Archive, and co-founder of Sinetology, a Charlotte-based electronic music label and collective with a focus on hardware and live events.
